data.title: Saskatchewan Association of Rural Municipalities
data.meta_description: SARM Member Divisions Printable PDF Map + RM Listing: 8.5×11 or 11×17
data.meta_site_name: SARM | Saskatchewan Association of Rural Municipalities
data.text:
SARM Division 1 encompasses 53 RMs in the southeastern part of the province.

The SARM Director for Division 1 is Bob Moulding.

The area's diverse landscapes range from flat prairie to the Qu'Appelle Valley and aspen parkland.

Major industries in the area are:

Agriculture

Oil, gas, and coal production

Power generation

Potash mining

Rural Municipalities in Division 1

Argyle No. 1 Moosomin No. 121 Mount Pleasant No. 2 Martin No. 122 Enniskillen No. 3 Silverwood No. 123 Coalfields No. 4 Kingsley No. 124 Estevan No. 5 Chester No. 125 Cambria No. 6 Montmartre No. 126 Souris Valley No. 7 Francis No. 127 Storthoaks No. 31 Rocanville No. 151 Reciprocity No. 32 Spy Hill No. 152 Moose Creek No. 33 Willowdale No. 153 Browning No. 34 Elcapo No. 154 Benson No. 35 Wolseley No. 155 Cymri No. 36 Indian Head No. 156 Lomond No. 37 South Qu'Appelle No. 157 Antler No. 61 Langenburg No. 181 Moose Mountain No. 63 Fertile Belt No. 183 Brock No. 64 Grayson No. 184 Tecumseh No. 65 McLeod No. 185 Griffin No. 66 Abernethy No. 186 Weyburn No. 67 North Qu'Appelle No. 187 Maryfield No. 91 Churchbridge No. 211 Walpole No. 92 Saltcoats No. 213 Wawken No. 93 Cana No. 214 Hazelwood No. 94 Stanley No. 215 Golden West No. 95 Tulleymet No. 216 Fillmore No. 96 Lipton No. 217 Wellington No. 97

SARM Division 2 is made up of the 51 RMs in the south central part of the province.

The SARM Director for Division 2 is Cody Jordison.

Natural vegetation is mainly mixed prairie.

Major industries in the area are:

Agriculture and ranching

Potash mining

Coal mining and power generation

Manufacturing

Lake Alma No. 8 Bratt's Lake No. 129 Surprise Valley No. 9 Redburn No. 130 Happy Valley No. 10 Baildon No. 131 Hart Butte No. 11 Hillsborough No. 132 Poplar Valley No. 12 Rodgers No. 133 Laurier No. 38 Shamrock No. 134 The Gap No. 39 Edenwold No. 158 Bengough No. 40 Sherwood No. 159 Willow Bunch No. 42 Pense No. 160 Old Post No. 43 Moose Jaw No. 161 Waverley No. 44 Caron No. 162 Brokenshell No. 68 Wheatlands No. 163 Norton No. 69 Chaplin No. 164 Key West No. 70 Lumsden No. 189 Excel No. 71 Dufferin No. 190 Lake of the Rivers No. 72 Marquis No. 191 Stonehenge No. 73 Eyebrow No. 193 Wood River No. 74 Enfield No. 194 Scott No. 98 Cupar No. 218 Caledonia No. 99 Longlaketon No. 219 Elmsthorpe No. 100 McKillop No. 220 Terrell No. 101 Sarnia No. 221 Lake Johnson No. 102 Craik No. 222 Sutton No. 103 Huron No. 223 Gravelbourg No. 104 Maple Bush No. 224 Lajord No. 128

SARM Division 3, located in the south west, is made up of 45 RMs.

The SARM Director for Division 3 is Darren Steinley.

Natural vegetation is mainly mixed prairie. The Cypress Hills and the Great Sandhills are unique areas in the region. The Cypress Hills is the only area in the province where lodgepole pines grow.

Archeological finds such as dinosaur bones are also found within the area. A nearly complete T.Rex skeleton, a rare find, was found near Eastend a few years ago.

Major industries in the area are:

Agriculture and ranching

Oil and gas

Manufacturing

Tourism

Rural Municipalities in Division 3

Val Marie No. 17 Gull Lake No. 139 Lone Tree No. 18 Big Stick No. 141 Frontier No. 19 Enterprise No. 142 Mankota No. 45 Morse No. 165 Glen McPherson No. 46 Excelsior No. 166 White Valley No. 49 Saskatchewan Landing No. 167 Reno No. 51 Riverside No. 168 Pinto Creek No. 75 Pittville No. 169 Auvergne No. 76 Fox Valley No. 171 Wise Creek No. 77 Canaan No. 225 Grassy Creek No. 78 Victory No. 226 Arlington No. 79 Lacadena No. 228 Glen Bain No. 105 Miry Creek No. 229 Whiska Creek No. 106 Clinworth No. 230 Lac Pelletier No. 107 Happyland No. 231 Bone Creek No. 108 Deer Forks No. 232 Carmichael No. 109 Coteau No. 255 Piapot No. 110 King George No. 256 Maple Creek No. 111 Monet No. 257 Lawtonia No. 135 Snipe Lake No. 259 Coulee No. 136 Newcombe No. 260 Swift Current No. 137 Chesterfield No. 261 Webb No. 138
